summary: This document is a chain of emails from July-August 2021 between a Senior Paralegal at FedEx and a federal prosecutor (likely from the SDNY) regarding a request for a records custodian to authenticate and potentially testify about FedEx shipping records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss locating records from 2007-2020, a 2008 subpoena from the SD of Florida, and preparation for the Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the investigation and records search; her trial is mentioned as scheduled to start in New York in November.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The records search is for any accounts or data associated with him; a FedEx paralegal explicitly asks if this is 'the' Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Tracy Ferrara
persons.context: Identified as the FedEx point of contact for a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008.

persons.name: Erin Markevitch
persons.context: Sends an introductory email to connect a FedEx paralegal with an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same records search by federal prosecutors, indicating their association in the investigation.
Ferrara was the FedEx point of contact for a 2008 subpoena related to Epstein, indicating she handled records pertaining to him.

events.title: SD Florida Subpoena to FedEx
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx, with Tracy Ferrara as the point of contact.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Scheduled
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

events.title: FedEx Records Search and Custodian Identification
events.description: Email correspondence between FedEx legal and federal prosecutors to locate shipping records (2007-2020) for Epstein/Maxwell and identify a records custodian to sign an affidavit or testify at trial.

locations: New York, New York 10007 (Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrews Plaza)
keyFacts: Federal prosecutors were actively seeking FedEx shipping records for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell from 2007-2020 in preparation for Maxwell's November 2021 trial.
A prior subpoena for FedEx records related to Epstein was issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008.
The correspondence shows prosecutors needed a FedEx records custodian to authenticate documents, sign an affidavit, and be prepared to testify at trial.
FedEx's IT system could not retrieve data from before 2007 for the account in question.
